comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The first rail bridge near Brooklyn ca.1889, looking south. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawkesbury_River_Railway_Bridge

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From the other end (Star Photo Co.) - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413737

comment.author: 79583367@N02
comment._content: Interetsting that the bridge's nameplate is on the northern end, ie, furthest from Sydney.  That's also quite a sharp curve for the tracks, immediately after leaving the "straight' on the bridge!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79583367@N02] The GoogleSatellitePhoto shows the old bridge piers and the original alignment of the single-line track (according to wikipedia article) either end. It does look like a tight corner in this photo.
